isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Service (1994) - ROCKER ARM ASSEMBLY, CAMSHAFT, TAPPETS AND PUSH RODS - CAMSHAFT, TAPPETS & PUSH RODS - CAMSHAFT CLEANING AND INSPECTION

step1.para: Wash the camshaft in a suitable solvent using a soft bristle brush.
Visually inspect camshaft. If any lobes are scuffed, scored or cracked, replace camshaft.
Beyond visual inspection, evaluate camshaft journal and lobe condition using a micrometer as follows:

step2.para:
Check camshaft lobe wear using a micrometer as follows: Refer to Figure 5.21
.
Measure across (A-C) and across (B-D). Visually Subtract (B-D) from (A-C). This will give cam lobe lift. (See "SPECIFICATIONS".) Replace camshaft when cam lobe wear exceeds specifications.

step1.para: Visually inspect thrust plate for wear, cracks or distortion. Use a micrometer to measure thrust plate thickness (see "SPECIFICATIONS"). Replace thrust plate if worn, damaged or if excessive end play is measured, as previously described.
Visually inspect camgear for worn or damaged teeth and gear bore for damage. Replace camgear if any of these conditions exist.

note.para: If camgear backlash exceeds specifications, replace the gear.

step1.para: Repeat steps 1 thru 3 for each cam lobe.
